searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Here are a few tips you might find useful. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: What are API Keys?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: API keys are secret tokens that authenticate your requests to our API. They act like passwords for your applications.  Properties:  Unique to your accountBearer token authenticationCan be revoked anytimeSupport different permissions

searchDocs.title: Via Dashboard‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Settings ‚Üí APIClick "Generate New Key"Configure key: Name: Production App Description: Main application backend Permissions: Read/Write Rate Limit: Default Expires: Never (or set date) Click "Create Key"Copy immediately (shown only once!)

searchDocs.title: Via API‚Äã
searchDocs.content: POST /v1/api-keys Authorization: Bearer EXISTING_API_KEY Content-Type: application/json { "name": "New Integration", "permissions": ["tasks:read", "tasks:write"], "expires_at": "2026-10-14T00:00:00Z" }   Response:  { "id": "key_abc123", "key": "sk_live_xyz789...", "name": "New Integration", "permissions": ["tasks:read", "tasks:write"], "created_at": "2025-10-14T10:30:00Z", "expires_at": "2026-10-14T00:00:00Z" }   Save Your Key! The full key is only shown once at creation. Store it securely immediately.

searchDocs.title: Permission Scopes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Control what each key can access:  Read Permissions:  tasks:read - View tasksprojects:read - View projectsusers:read - View users  Write Permissions:  tasks:write - Create/update tasksprojects:write - Create/update projectsusers:write - Create/update users  Delete Permissions:  tasks:delete - Delete tasksprojects:delete - Delete projects  Admin Permissions:  admin:* - Full access (dangerous!)

searchDocs.content: Rotate keys regularly:  Rotation process:  Create new keyUpdate services to use new keyTest thoroughlyRevoke old keyMonitor for issues  Recommended frequency:  Production: Every 90 daysDevelopment: Every 180 daysImmediately if compromised

searchDocs.content: GET /v1/api-keys Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY   Response:  { "data": [ { "id": "key_123", "name": "Production App", "prefix": "sk_live_abc...", "last_used": "2025-10-14T10:30:00Z", "created_at": "2025-01-01T00:00:00Z", "expires_at": null }, { "id": "key_456", "name": "Mobile App", "prefix": "sk_live_def...", "last_used": "2025-10-14T09:15:00Z", "created_at": "2025-03-15T00:00:00Z", "expires_at": "2026-03-15T00:00:00Z" } ] }   Note Full keys are never returned after creation. Only the prefix is shown for identification.

searchDocs.content: Recommended for:  Web applicationsMobile appsDesktop applications  Flow diagram:  1. Your App ‚Üí User ‚Üí Login Page (our site) 2. User grants permission 3. Redirect back with authorization code 4. Your App ‚Üí Exchange code for access token 5. Use access token to make API requests

searchDocs.content: // Step 1: Redirect to authorization app.get('/login', (req, res) => { const state = generateRandomString(); req.session.oauthState = state; const authUrl = new URL('https://app.example.com/oauth/authorize'); authUrl.searchParams.append('client_id', CLIENT_ID); authUrl.searchParams.append('redirect_uri', REDIRECT_URI); authUrl.searchParams.append('response_type', 'code'); authUrl.searchParams.append('scope', 'tasks:read tasks:write'); authUrl.searchParams.append('state', state); res.redirect(authUrl.toString()); }); // Step 2: Handle callback app.get('/oauth/callback', async (req, res) => { const { code, state } = req.query; // Verify state if (state !== req.session.oauthState) { return res.status(400).send('Invalid state'); } // Exchange code for token const tokenResponse = await fetch('https://app.example.com/oauth/token', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' }, body: new URLSearchParams({ grant_type: 'authorization_code', code, client_id: CLIENT_ID, client_secret: CLIENT_SECRET, redirect_uri: REDIRECT_URI }) }); const tokens = await tokenResponse.json(); // Store tokens securely req.session.accessToken = tokens.access_token; req.session.refreshToken = tokens.refresh_token; res.redirect('/dashboard'); }); // Step 3: Use token app.get('/my-tasks', async (req, res) => { const response = await fetch('https://api.example.com/v1/tasks', { headers: { 'Authorization': `Bearer ${req.session.accessToken}` } }); const tasks = await response.json(); res.json(tasks); });

searchDocs.content: from flask import Flask, redirect, request, session import requests app = Flask(__name__) app.secret_key = 'your-secret-key' CLIENT_ID = 'your-client-id' CLIENT_SECRET = 'your-client-secret' REDIRECT_URI = 'http://localhost:5000/oauth/callback' @app.route('/login') def login(): state = generate_random_string() session['oauth_state'] = state auth_url = ( f'https://app.example.com/oauth/authorize' f'?client_id={CLIENT_ID}' f'&redirect_uri={REDIRECT_URI}' f'&response_type=code' f'&scope=tasks:read tasks:write' f'&state={state}' ) return redirect(auth_url) @app.route('/oauth/callback') def callback(): code = request.args.get('code') state = request.args.get('state') # Verify state if state != session.get('oauth_state'): return 'Invalid state', 400 # Exchange code for token token_response = requests.post( 'https://app.example.com/oauth/token', data={ 'grant_type': 'authorization_code', 'code': code, 'client_id': CLIENT_ID, 'client_secret': CLIENT_SECRET, 'redirect_uri': REDIRECT_URI } ) tokens = token_response.json() # Store tokens session['access_token'] = tokens['access_token'] session['refresh_token'] = tokens['refresh_token'] return redirect('/dashboard') @app.route('/my-tasks') def my_tasks(): response = requests.get( 'https://api.example.com/v1/tasks', headers={ 'Authorization': f"Bearer {session['access_token']}" } ) return response.json()

searchDocs.title: Verify Signature‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Important: Always verify webhook signatures!  const crypto = require('crypto'); function verifyWebhook(payload, signature, secret) { const expectedSignature = crypto .createHmac('sha256', secret) .update(payload) .digest('hex'); return crypto.timingSafeEqual( Buffer.from(signature), Buffer.from(expectedSignature) ); } app.post('/webhooks', (req, res) => { const signature = req.headers['x-webhook-signature']; const payload = JSON.stringify(req.body); if (!verifyWebhook(payload, signature, WEBHOOK_SECRET)) { return res.status(401).send('Invalid signature'); } // Process webhook const { event, data } = req.body; if (event === 'task.created') { console.log('New task:', data.name); } res.status(200).send('OK'); });

searchDocs.title: Retry Logic‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Implement exponential backoff for retries:  async function fetchWithRetry(url, options, maxRetries = 3) { for (let i = 0; i < maxRetries; i++) { try { const response = await fetch(url, options); if (response.status === 429) { // Rate limited, wait and retry const retryAfter = response.headers.get('Retry-After') || 60; await sleep(retryAfter * 1000); continue; } if (response.status >= 500) { // Server error, retry with exponential backoff await sleep(Math.pow(2, i) * 1000); continue; } return response; } catch (error) { if (i === maxRetries - 1) throw error; await sleep(Math.pow(2, i) * 1000); } } }

searchDocs.title: What is Automation?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Automation lets you create rules that trigger actions automatically based on specific conditions. Think of it as "if this happens, then do that."  When [trigger] happens And [conditions] are met Then [actions] are performed

searchDocs.title: Basic Rule Structure‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Example: Auto-assign to team lead  Rule Name: Assign high-priority bugs to lead Trigger: Task created Conditions: - Label contains "bug" - Priority is "High" or "Critical" Actions: - Assign to @team-lead - Send notification - Add comment: "High priority bug detected"

searchDocs.title: Step-by-Step Creation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Project Settings ‚Üí "Automation"Click "Create Rule"Choose triggerAdd conditions (optional)Select actionsName and save rule

searchDocs.content: Field | Operators | Examples -------------|---------------------|------------------- Status | is, is not | "In Progress" Priority | is, is not | "High", "Critical" Assignee | is, is not, is empty| @john, @team Due Date | is, before, after | Tomorrow, Oct 30 Labels | contains, not | "bug", "urgent" Project | is, is not | "Website Redesign" Created by | is, is not | @sarah Custom field | is, contains | Budget > 1000

searchDocs.content: AND - All conditions must be true OR - At least one condition must be true NOT - Condition must not be true   Example:  When task created AND priority is "High" OR label contains "urgent" AND assignee is empty Then assign to @manager

searchDocs.title: Generate a new site‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Generate a new Docusaurus site using the classic template.  The classic template will automatically be added to your project after you run the command:  npm init docusaurus@latest my-website classic   You can type this command into Command Prompt, Powershell, Terminal, or any other integrated terminal of your code editor.  The command also installs all necessary dependencies you need to run Docusaurus.

searchDocs.title: Start your site‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Run the development server:  cd my-website npm run start   The cd command changes the directory you're working with. In order to work with your newly created Docusaurus site, you'll need to navigate the terminal there.  The npm run start command builds your website locally and serves it through a development server, ready for you to view at http://localhost:3000/.  Open docs/intro.md (this page) and edit some lines: the site reloads automatically and displays your changes.

searchDocs.content: Follow these steps to create your workflow:  Go to your project -> click the three dots -> Project Settings -> WorkflowsClick + Add WorkflowFill in the details:  Field	DescriptionName	Give it a clear name like ‚ÄúAuto-close completed tasks‚Äù or ‚ÄúAlert on overdue‚Äù. searchDocs.title: Define a Rule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This is the brain of your workflow ‚Äì the exact ‚Äúif this, then that‚Äù logic.  Trigger (mandatory): The event that starts the workflow.Certain examples are like: Task status changedDue date passedNew comment addedSubtask completed.    Conditions (optional): Extra checks before running.Certain examples are like: Only if Priority = HighOnly if Assignee = Marketing TeamOnly if Tags contain ‚Äúurgent‚Äù.    Action (mandatory): What actually happens.Certain examples are like: Change status to DoneAssign to ManagerAdd tag ‚Äúreview-needed‚ÄùSend notificationMove to section ‚ÄúSection 5‚Äù.    Save your workflow.    Your new workflow instantly appears in the List of Workflows and starts working immediately (toggle it off anytime if you want to pause it). That‚Äôs it - one workflow, hundreds of clicks saved every week!

searchDocs.title: Edit Workflow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Open your project -> three dots -> Project Settings -> Workflows Find the workflow you want to change ‚Üí click on Three dots -> click on Edit (pencil icon).    Update whatever you need: Mark as Active/Inactive Click on Toggle button to make your workflow active/inactive. Name of Workflow Make it clearer or rename it completely. Icon and Color Change the look so it stands out better in the list. Description Add or update notes for your teammates. Define a Rule Fine-tune the logic exactly like when you created it: Trigger ‚Äì change or keep what starts the workflowConditions ‚Äì add, remove, or adjust the ‚Äúonly if‚Äù checksAction ‚Äì swap, add, or remove what happens automatically Click Save Workflow  Your updated workflow takes effect immediately - no restart needed. searchDocs.title: Why Workflow is Important‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ends the daily grind of moving tasks, updating statuses, or chasing people.Makes your team 10x faster without extra effort.Keeps every project consistent - even when different people work on it.Turns chaos into clockwork, every single time.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Workflow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Lives inside one project (keeps things clean and safe).Super-simple setup: pick a Trigger ‚Üí add Conditions (optional) ‚Üí choose Actions.Runs instantly and silently in the background.Logs every single move in the Activity Stream so you always know what happened.You can turn it on/off or edit it any time.  In short: one Workflow = hundreds of manual clicks saved. Build a few good ones and watch your project basically run itself.

searchDocs.title: Why is Automation Important‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Stops tasks from falling through the cracks.Saves hours every week on boring updates.Keeps everyone in sync without endless ‚Äúhey, did you‚Ä¶?‚Äù messages.Makes sure nothing gets missed when people are busy or on leave.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Automation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Works only inside the project where you create it.Triggers instantly when something changes (status update, new comment, due date passed, etc.).Can check extra conditions before running (‚Äúonly if priority is High‚Äù).Does useful actions: change status, assign people, add tags, send notifications, move tasks.Shows exactly what it did and when in the Activity Stream.  Think of it as giving your project a brain that never sleeps. You teach it your rules once, then go focus on real work while 5day.io keeps everything moving perfectly.

searchDocs.title: How Actions work‚Äã
searchDocs.content: After trigger fires -> conditions pass -> 5day.io instantly runs every action in your list (top to bottom). You can stack as many actions as you want.  Actions comes with two categories:  Field-update ActionsEmail Actions

searchDocs.title: Field-update Actions (set any field automatically)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can set every single field that exists on tasks/subtasks  Field	DescriptionStatus	Set a specific Status Priority	Set a specific priority Budget Type	Set a budget type - Billable/Non-billable Progress	Set a progress Estimation	Set an Estimation - Support all 5 formats Tags	Add/Remove a tag Section	Move to a section Assignee	Add/Remove assignee Start Date	Set a dynamic/custom start date Due Date	Set a dynamic/custom due date

searchDocs.title: Email & Notification Actions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Select Email -> Send Email to create a full email that flies out.  Field	DescriptionTo	Add single/multiple email addresses to which the email needs to be sent. Cc	Add people in Cc. Subject	Set a subject for an email Body	Add the static & Dynamic content (your task's fields) in email body. Attachment	To attach a specific file in email

searchDocs.title: Why use Conditions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Catch only the tasks that matter (e.g., ignore low-priority stuff).Prevent automation spam (no more 50 notifications for every tiny change).Handle complex real-world rules without creating 10 separate workflows.

searchDocs.title: How Conditions work‚Äã
searchDocs.content: After a trigger fires, 5day.io checks your conditions from left to right.  AND (default between main conditions): All must be trueOR (when you nest): At least one group must be true Conditions apply to the task/subtask that triggered the workflow.  Nested Logic This is where it gets powerful. Click + Add Nested to create groups with OR inside AND (or vice versa):  Logic Type	What it means	When to use	ExampleAND (main level)	All conditions must be true	Strict rules	Priority is High AND Assignee is Sarah OR (nested)	Any one nested condition is true	Flexible options	Priority is Highest OR Tag contains "urgent" Nested AND/OR	Mix them for pro-level control	Complex scenarios	(Priority High OR Tag "urgent") AND Due Date is today

searchDocs.content: Field Type	Operators	ExamplesTextbox	Equal, Does not Equal, Contains, Does not Contains	Task Name contains Blog Dropdown	Is One Of, Is Not One Of, Equals, Not Equals, Is Empty, Is not Empty	Tags Is Empty Date	On or Before, On or After, Equals, Not Equals, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty	Start Date is On or Before 3rd Jan 2025 Time	On or Before, On or After, Equals, Not Equals, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty	Time is After 3:00 PM Number	Greater Than, Less Than, Greater Than or Equal, Less Than or Equal, Equals, Not Equals, Is Empty, Is Not Empty	Estimation is Greater Than 5d Percentage	Greater Than, Less Than, Greater Than or Equal, Less Than or Equal, Equals, Not Equals, Is Empty, Is Not Empty	Progress is Greater Than 60%  Conditions make your automations bulletproof. Start simple (one condition), then nest as you need more smarts.

searchDocs.content: You pick what to watch: Task only / Subtask only / Any (both)You choose when it should fireThe moment that event happens -> your workflow wakes up and runs the actions Triggers fire instantly, use your project‚Äôs timezone, and never sleep.

searchDocs.title: Why is Custom Field Important‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Custom fields are your secret weapon for tailoring 5day.io to your exact workflow - no more forcing square pegs into round holes. They capture unique data like client codes, approval stages, or risk levels, giving every project the precision it deserves. With them, you gain deeper insights, faster decisions, and zero data gaps, turning generic tracking into a custom-fit powerhouse that scales with your team‚Äôs needs.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Custom Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Flexible Types & Placement: Choose from text, dates, dropdowns, numbers, URLs, and more - place fields in projects, tasks, or subtasks exactly where you need them.Central Library with Global Sync: Create once in the Custom Field Library, use everywhere - edits update instantly across all projects and tasks.Granular Control: Add fields at account, workspace, or project; make them required, filterable, or visible in views, boards, and reports.Seamless Integration: Auto-sync with filters, group-by, list/board views, and analytics - your custom data flows effortlessly into planning and reporting.

searchDocs.content: You can easily add existing members of your 5day.io workspace to a project using one of two methods. This ensures the right people have access and visibility to collaborate on the project tasks.

searchDocs.title: Overview¬†‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Projects in 5day.io are how you organize and manage a group of tasks that are part of a larger goal, initiative, or deliverable. Every task you create belongs to a project, making it easier to group related work, assign responsibilities, and track progress in one central place. Use projects to:¬†  Group related tasks under one initiative.¬†Set timelines with project start and end dates.¬†Track progress using different views such as List or Board.¬†Collaborate with your team using files, and discussions.¬†Get visibility into all task-level details without losing sight of the big picture.¬†  Each project supports additional metadata like project description, client assignment (if enabled), tags, custom fields, and more‚Äîso your team has all the context in one place.¬†  ‚úÖ Projects form the foundation for execution in 5day.io. Whether you're launching a new product, running a client engagement, or managing an internal sprint, it all starts with creating a project.

searchDocs.title: Subscription Association: Projects¬†‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Projects feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io. However, the number of projects you can create depends on your subscription tier:¬†

searchDocs.title: Project Creation Limits by Subscription Plan‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Subscription Plan Project Creation Limit¬†Free Plan Up to 5 Projects Growth Plan Unlimited Projects

searchDocs.title: Who Can Create and Manage Projects¬†‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Account Owners, Account Admins, and Managers (default roles) can create, access, and manage projects.¬†Custom Role Users with the Add permission enabled for Projects in Security & Permissions can also create projects.¬†  ‚†Ä‚úÖ Project creation access is controlled through role-based permissions in Security & Permissions.

searchDocs.title: Project Attributes¬†‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Each project in 5day.io includes a set of configurable attributes that help you define the scope and track the status:

searchDocs.content: You'll be prompted to fill in:¬†  Project Name ‚Äì The name of your project¬†Where ‚Äì The workspace or space under which the project will be created¬†Description ‚Äì (Optional) A brief explanation of the project¬†Duration ‚Äì Start Date and Due Date to set a timeline¬†  ‚†Ä¬†

searchDocs.title: After Project Creation (in Project Settings):¬†‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can further configure:¬†  Priority ‚Äì Choose from predefined levels (e.g., High, Medium, Low)¬†Budget Type ‚Äì Select whether the project is billable or non-billable¬†Prefix ‚Äì A short code added to all tasks ID within the project (e.g., MKTG-101)¬†Progress ‚Äì Track % completion of the project¬†Owner ‚Äì Assign responsibility to a specific person¬†Description ‚Äì Update or expand the project summary¬†Client ‚Äì Tag the project to a specific client. (This option is available only if the Client feature is enabled in Project Settings.)¬†Custom Fields ‚Äì Add fields like budget, department, or tags as per your needs¬†  ‚†ÄThese attributes are accessible via the Project Settings menu and can be updated at any time.¬†

searchDocs.content: To edit the project info in 5day.io, follow these steps:  Go to Project Settings: First, navigate to the Project Settings of the project you want to edit.

If there are multiple owners, click Add Owner and add additional users.Project Description: Write a description for the project to provide more context or details. searchDocs.title: How to Enable or Disable Views in a Project‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can customize which views are available for your project, such as List, Board, Timesheet, Dashboard, Files, and more.  Steps to Enable or Disable Views:‚Äã  Open the Project Navigate to the project where you want to update the views. Image‚Äã Access Project Settings Click the three-dot menu (Ô∏ô) in the top-right corner of the project. Select Project Settings from the dropdown.  ‚úÖ Only users with permission to manage project settings will be able to modify views.  Go to the Views Tab Inside Project Settings, click on the Views tab. Image‚Äã Configure Views You‚Äôll see a list of available views like: List View: The default way to display tasks in a clear, table-style list.Board View: A visual Kanban-style board where tasks appear as cards that can be dragged between columns based on status or other groupings.Timesheet: Allows you to track and log time spent on tasks, with options to view by day, week, or month.Dashboard: Displays project performance using widgets and charts, giving you a quick overview of key metrics.Files: A dedicated space to upload, store, and manage files related to the project.Discussion: Enables a chat-like space where team members can post updates, tag colleagues (@mention), and hold project-specific discussions.Activity Stream: Provides a detailed log of all activity related to the project‚Äîsuch as who changed what, when a feature was enabled/disabled, or when settings were updated. List View is always enabled and cannot be disabled.Use the toggle switches next to each view to turn them on or off based on your preference.You can also reorder views to set the preferred navigation order by dragging them up or down. Changes are Saved Automatically Once you make your selections, the settings are applied instantly‚Äîno need to click Save.

searchDocs.title: How to Import Tasks into a Project (From the Project Level)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can import tasks into a project in 5day.io using two methods. Here's how:  Method 1: Importing from the Project List‚Äã  Navigate to the Project List: Go to the list of all your projects. Click on the Three-Dot Menu: Next to the project where you want to import tasks, click on the three-dot menu.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Select 'Import': In the dropdown, select Import. This will open the task import dialog.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Download the Sample File: Once the import dialog appears, click on Download Sample File. This will download an Excel file with two sheets: a. Template Sheet: This is where you need to input all the task details. b. Guideline Sheet: This sheet provides guidelines for entering data correctly for each field. Enter Data in the Template: Open the Excel file, and fill in the task details in the Template sheet. Refer to the Guidelinesheet if you need help understanding the data format or field requirements. Save the File: After entering the necessary details, save the file. Upload the File: Return to the import dialog and click onUpload from Computer. Select the saved file and click onImport to import the task data into 5day.io.  Method 2: Importing from Project Settings‚Äã  Go to Project Settings: Navigate to the project settings of the project you want to import tasks into.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: View Data Import History: In the settings, you will see an option for Data Import History. Click on 'Import': In the Data Import History section, click on Import to begin the process.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Download the Sample File: Like in Method 1, you can download theSample File from the import dialog. Enter Data in the Template: Open the downloaded file, and fill in the task details in the Template sheet. Use the Guidelinesheet for assistance on field requirements. Upload and Import: After saving the file, go back to the import dialog and click on Upload from Computer. Select your file and click on Import to upload the tasks into the project.  Data Import History‚Äã

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Once the tasks are imported, you can view the import details in theData Import History section. Here, you will see:  Date and Time of import File Imported Imported By (the user who initiated the import) Type (type of import) Status (success or failure) Total Records (number of records in the file) Records Imported (successful imports) Records Failed (failed imports)  If there are any issues with the import, the system will display:  The records that failed to import  You can also download an Excel file listing the records that failed. This allows you to identify and correct any issues with the data.

searchDocs.title: How to Enable and Disable Project Features‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To enable or disable project features in 5day.io, follow these steps:  Go to Project Settings: First, navigate to the Project Settings of the project you want to configure.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click on 'Features': Once in Project Settings, click on the Features tab.Enable or Disable Features: In the features list, you'll see a range of features with toggle buttons next to each one. You can toggle on or off the features you want to enable or disable for that particular project. Here is a list of project features that you can enable or disable: Subtasks: Divide large tasks into smaller, manageable parts.Priority: Set task priority levels.Client: Track work for a specific client at the project level.Multiple Assignee: Assign tasks to multiple people.Tags: Use custom tags to organize tasks.Project Finance: Track billable, non-billable, and budget information.Time Tracking: Track time for various types of work.Time Estimates: Track time estimates for tasks.Time Approval: Enforce manual approval for time entries.Overtime: Track overtime hours in timesheets.Story Points: Estimate the effort required to complete tasks.Assignee Wise Estimation: Divide estimated task time among multiple assignees.Custom Fields: Add custom fields to tasks for additional information.Multiple Task Types: Assign and associate multiple task types within a project.Sprint Management: Divide your project into time-boxed sprints (e.g., 2-week periods) to focus on specific goals and track progress within each sprint. Save Changes: Once you've made the necessary modifications, your changes will be saved automatically.Go Back: After you‚Äôre done, click the Back button to return to the list of projects.

searchDocs.title: Who can Manage‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, a Space is a unit nested within a Workspace - typically used to group related projects, departments, or modules. Just like Workspace, Space management is governed by user roles and their associated permission sets.  These permissions ensure the right people have the right level of access, from visibility to full management rights, over each Space within a Workspace.

searchDocs.title: Key Permission Types‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Permission Type	DescriptionView	Controls which space user can view in the workspace. Add	Controls whether user is allowed to create new space. Edit	Controls the ability to manage and update space. Delete	Controls the ability to delete space.  Each of these permissions has granular levels like All, Own, Related, or None depending on how much access a user should have.

searchDocs.title: Permission Levels‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Permission Level	DescriptionAll	Applies to all spaces in the workspace, regardless of ownership or membership. Related	Applies to all the associated project's spaces where user is either the project owner or a project member. None	The user does not have any access for the selected action

searchDocs.title: Space Permission Matrix‚Äã
searchDocs.content: | Type | All | Related | None | |--|--| -- | -- | -- | | View | Can view all spaces in the workspace| Can view only project associated spaces where you are either project owner or project member | | Add | Can create new space| - | Cannot create new space| | Edit | Can edit all spaces| Can edit project associated spaces where you are either project owner or project member | Cannot edit any space| | Delete | Can delete any space in workspace| Can delete project associated spaces where you are either project owner or project member | Cannot delete any space. |  Note: ‚ÄúSpace Edit‚Äù permission grants access to modify the core settings of a Projects, including timesheets, workflows, and task types.

searchDocs.title: Best Practices‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Account Owner or Admins should have All permissions for full control.  Department heads or project managers can be given Related permissions based on their roles in organization.  General team members should typically have None for sensitive actions like editing or deleting workspaces.  Ensure only limited users have Delete permissions to prevent accidental data loss.

searchDocs.title: Why is a Subtask Important?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Subtasks are the secret sauce that turns big, intimidating Tasks into bite-sized wins - making progress feel real and momentum unstoppable. Here‚Äôs why they‚Äôre a game-changer in 5day.io:  Breaks Down Complexity: A Task like ‚ÄúLaunch Website‚Äù sounds scary - Subtasks turn it into ‚ÄúDesign homepage ‚Üí Write copy ‚Üí Test on mobile,‚Äù so nothing feels overwhelming.Boosts Clarity & Ownership: Each Subtask can be assigned to a specific person with a clear deadline, so everyone knows exactly what they‚Äôre responsible for - no more ‚ÄúI thought you were doing that.‚ÄùEnables Parallel Work: Subtasks let teams move fast in sync, without stepping on toes.Improves Accuracy in Tracking: See real-time progress roll up to the parent Task.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Subtask‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 5day.io Subtasks are lightweight but mighty, packed with smart features to keep execution smooth and satisfying:  Nested Hierarchy: Live directly under a parent Task - drag, drop, indent, or outdent with one click to restructure on the fly.Independent Assignment & Due Dates: Assign a Subtask to a different person than the parent Task, set unique deadlines, and get personal reminders - perfect for cross-functional handoffs.Status & Progress Sync: Mark Subtasks as To Do, In Progress, or Done - watch completion percentages.Comments & Attachments: Discuss, @mention, or attach files per Subtask - keep context close to the action, no digging through endless threads.Time Tracking: Log time spent on individual Subtasks for accurate effort reporting - great for client billing or personal productivity insights.Bulk Actions: Select multiple Subtasks to update status, reassign, or delete in one go - save clicks, crush repetition.Roll-Up Reporting: Subtask data feeds directly into Task analytics - see who‚Äôs overloaded, what‚Äôs delayed, and what‚Äôs crushing it - all in one dashboard.  Subtasks aren‚Äôt just smaller Tasks - they‚Äôre precision tools for focus, flow, and flawless delivery. Use them well, and you‚Äôll wonder how you ever managed without them.

searchDocs.title: Why is a Task Important?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Tasks are the backbone of any successful project in 5day.io, serving as the foundational building blocks that transform high-level project goals into actionable reality.  Here's why they matter:  Clarity and Focus: In a fast-paced work environment, Tasks provide a clear roadmap, helping teams understand exactly what needs to be done, by when, and by whom - reducing confusion and preventing scope creep.Prioritization and Efficiency: By assigning due dates, dependencies, and priorities, Tasks ensure critical work gets attention first, allowing teams to allocate resources wisely and hit deadlines without burnout.Accountability and Collaboration: Tasks foster ownership - whether solo or team-based - making it easy to delegate, track progress, and celebrate wins, which boosts morale and strengthens team dynamics.Scalability for Growth: As projects evolve, Tasks enable seamless scaling; what starts as a simple to-do can expand into subtasks, keeping everything organized even as complexity increases.  In essence, without Tasks, projects risk becoming chaotic wish lists. They empower users to execute with precision, turning ambition into measurable results and driving overall productivity sky-high.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Task‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 5day.io's Tasks are designed with intuitive, powerful features to streamline your workflow. Here are the standout ones:  Creation and Customization: Easily create Tasks with rich details like descriptions, attachments, labels, and custom fields - tailor them to fit your project's unique needs right from the start.Assignment and Collaboration: Assign Tasks to individuals or teams, set permissions for editing/viewing, and enable real-time message or @mentions for seamless feedback loops and issue resolution.Progress Tracking: Use built-in status updates (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Done), time estimates, and automated notifications to monitor completion rates and spot bottlenecks early.Integration with Subtasks: Break down any Task into nested Subtasks for granular control, with roll-up reporting that shows how subtasks contribute to the parent Task's overall progress.Reporting and Analytics: Generate insights like completion timelines, workload distribution, and performance metrics‚Äîexportable for stakeholder updates or retrospectives.  These features make Tasks not just a tool, but a smart companion that adapts to your rhythm, saving time and amplifying impact.

searchDocs.title: Who can Manage‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, task management capabilities are controlled through user roles and permission sets. These define what each user can view, create, edit, or delete in the project environment.  Understanding these permissions ensures the right level of control is maintained across different user roles ‚Äî such as Admins, Managers, or Collaborators ‚Äî while keeping the project secure and structured.

searchDocs.title: Key Permission Types‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Permission Type	DescriptionView	Controls which tasks user can view in the project. Add	Controls whether user is allowed to create new task. Edit	Controls the ability to manage and update task. Delete	Controls the ability to delete task.  Each of these permissions has granular levels like All, Own, Related, or None depending on how much access a user should have.

searchDocs.title: Permission Levels‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Permission Level	DescriptionAll	Applies to all tasks in the project, regardless of ownership. Own	Applies only to tasks where user is Task Owner. Related	Applies to tasks in which user is added as Project Owner or Project member None	The user does not have any access for the selected action

searchDocs.title: Project Permission Matrix‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Type	All	Own	Related	NoneView	Can view all tasks in the project	-	Can view only tasks where user is task owner	- Add	Can create new task	-	-	Cannot create new task Edit	Can edit all tasks	Can edit only task where user is task owner	Can edit tasks where user is project owner or project member	Cannot edit any task Delete	Can delete any task	Can delete only tasks where user is task owner	Can delete tasks where user is project owner or project member	Cannot delete any task  Note: ‚ÄúTask Edit‚Äù permission grants access to modify all the details associated to task and subtask.

searchDocs.title: Best Practices‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Account Owner or Admins should have All permissions for full control.  Department heads or project managers can be given Edit - Related permissions based on their roles in organization.  General team members should typically have Edit - Own for sensitive actions like editing or deleting workspaces.  Ensure only limited users have Delete permissions to prevent accidental data loss.

searchDocs.title: Permission Set‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The ability to assign or edit dates is governed by the Edit Task permission set:  Edit All ‚Äì User can assign/change dates for any task or subtask.Edit Owned ‚Äì User can manage dates only for tasks/subtasks they own.Edit Related ‚Äì User can update dates for tasks within their associated projects.Edit None ‚Äì User cannot add or modify dates.  Refer Roles and Permission for more details.

searchDocs.title: Generic Details‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Every task and subtask in 5day.io includes Start Date and Due Date as default fields.  These fields are non-removable and are part of the core task framework.  The date format displayed is based on user preference and can be configured via: My Profile ‚Üí Display Settings ‚Üí Date Format.  Dates are validated automatically:  Due Date cannot be earlier than Start Date.It‚Äôs recommended to align task dates within the parent project‚Äôs date range for consistency.

searchDocs.content: Open a Task or Subtask Details.Locate the Start Date and Due Date fields.Select dates using the system calendar and save the task.

searchDocs.title: My Work‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Overdue‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A task or subtask is considered Overdue when the Due Date has passed, and the item is not marked as Completed.  Generic Points  If a task‚Äôs Due Date has passed and its status is still Open, In Progress, or any other non-final state, the system will automatically tag it as Overdue.  This tag will be visible across the platform in:  List ViewBoard ViewTask/Subtask Detail ViewMy Work (Refer to the ‚ÄúMy Work‚Äù help guide for details on filtering Overdue items.)  Quick Notes  Due Date cannot be earlier than Start Date. For effective planning, align task dates with their parent project‚Äôs timeline. Tasks with missed Due Dates that are not marked as Completed will automatically reflect Overdue status. Other References‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Task Header‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Task Header provides instant context with task location, overdue alerts, editable title, expand/collapse controls, a More actions menu and a close button to exit the panel.  Field	DescriptionTask Location	Displays the project and section where the task is located. Helps users know where the task belongs. Overdue	If the due date has passed and the task is not completed, an overdue icon will be shown. Title	Displays the title of the task/subtask. The title can be edited if permission allows. Expand/Collapse	Allows the task panel to be expanded to full screen or collapsed for easier navigation. More	Provides access to additional actions like Duplicate Task, Move Task, Delete Task, etc. Close	Closes the Task Details Panel and returns to the previous view.

searchDocs.title: Task Details‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Task Details Tabs organize everything in one place - edit core fields in Task Details, manage Subtasks, discuss in Discussion, attach files in Files, and review full history in Activity Stream.  Tab	DescriptionTask Details	Displays and allows editing of the core fields of the task (description, status, dates, assignees, etc.). Subtasks	View and manage the list of subtasks associated with the main task. Refer ‚ÄòSubtask‚Äô for more details. Discussion	Collaborate by adding comments, notes, or important discussions related to the task. Refer ‚ÄòDiscussion‚Äô for more details. Files	Manage files and attachments related to the task. Refer ‚ÄòFiles‚Äô for more details Activity Stream	Displays the activity history such as status changes, edits, comments, and file uploads. Refer ‚ÄòActivity Stream‚Äô for more details.

searchDocs.title: Task Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Task Fields let you define every detail of task - all editable based on permissions.  Field	DescriptionTask Description	Add or update the detailed information regarding the task. Status	Current status of the task (e.g., Active, Completed, On Hold). Refer ‚ÄòStatus‚Äô for more details. Progress	Shows task completion percentage based on manual update. Refer ‚ÄòProgress‚Äô for more details. Assignee	List of people assigned to work on the task. Refer ‚ÄòAssignee‚Äô for more details. Start Date	The date when the task is scheduled to start. Refer ‚ÄòDates‚Äô for more details. Due Date	The deadline date by which the task needs to be completed. Refer ‚ÄòDates‚Äô for more details. Tags	Custom labels to categorize or filter tasks easily. Refer ‚ÄòTags‚Äô for more details. Estimation	The estimated time (HH:MM) needed to complete the task. Refer ‚ÄòEstimation‚Äô for more details. Section	The section within the project where the task is organized. Refer ‚ÄòSection‚Äô for more details. Priority	Priority level assigned to the task (e.g., Highest, High, Medium, Low). Refer ‚ÄòPriority‚Äô for more details. Task Type	Type of task such as Enhancement, Bug, Feature, etc. Refer ‚ÄòTask Type‚Äô for more details. Story Point	Used mainly in Agile projects to estimate the effort required. Refer ‚ÄòStory Points‚Äô for more details. Budget Type	Categorizes task as Billable/None-billable. Refer ‚ÄòBudget Type‚Äô for more details. Link	A system-generated direct link to share the task. Refer ‚ÄòLink‚Äô for more details.

searchDocs.title: Permission Set‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Assignment of estimation values is controlled through the Edit Task permission set:  Edit All ‚Äì User can set estimation for any task or subtask.Edit Owned ‚Äì User can set estimation for tasks/subtasks they own.Edit Related ‚Äì User can set estimation for tasks/subtasks related to their projects.Edit None ‚Äì User cannot set or modify estimations.  Refer to the Permission Set Guide for more details.

searchDocs.title: Access and Manage Estimation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To enable the Estimation field for tasks and subtasks, the Time Estimates feature must be turned on at Project Settings ‚Üí Features ‚Üí Time Estimates.  Once enabled, the estimation field becomes available for all tasks and subtasks.  Estimation can be added and viewed in different formats, which can be configured from My Profile ‚Üí Display Settings ‚Üí Duration Format.  Supported Duration Formats:  Clock (hh:mm) ‚Äì Display estimation as hours and minutes format, e.g., 02:30.Days (dd.dd) ‚Äì Display estimation in decimal format of days, e.g., 1.50 days.Days, Hours, Minutes ‚Äì Break estimation into days, hours, and minutes separately.Hours (hh.hh) ‚Äì Display estimation in decimal format of hours, e.g., 5.75 hours.Hours, Minutes ‚Äì Display estimation specifically in hours and minutes fields.  The selected format applies across all views where estimation is used.

searchDocs.title: Assignee Wise Estimation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 5day.io also provides flexibility where, if a task is assigned to multiple people, estimation can vary individually for each assignee.  To enable this, turn on the Assignee Wise Estimation feature from Project Settings ‚Üí Features ‚Üí Assignee Wise Estimation.  Once enabled, the system will ask for handling already created tasks:  Split the estimation equally ‚Äì Divides existing estimations equally among all assignees.Disable equal division ‚Äì Keeps current estimations unchanged; users can manually configure later.  Going forward:  You can configure a different estimation value for each user assigned to a task.  If needed, you can choose not to apply assignee-wise estimation at the individual task level by disabling the Estimates by Person option during editing.  This provides complete flexibility to manage estimations either collectively or individually based on project needs.

searchDocs.content: You can add links to tasks through several interfaces in 5day.io. Here's how:

searchDocs.title: From List View / Board View / Task Details More Menu‚Äã
searchDocs.content: View	Access MethodList View	Click on the More (****‚ãÆ) icon at the end of the task row Board View	Click on the More (****‚ãÆ) icon at the top of the task card Task Details View	Click on the More (****‚ãÆ) icon at the top-right of the task detail panel  Once you click Add Link, the system will show all linkable tasks and subtasks within the same project. You can select one or multiple to create the link.

searchDocs.title: My Work‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Bulk Update‚Äã

Quick Note  You can create and assign as many tags as needed.Tags help in filtering, grouping, and organizing tasks/subtasks efficiently.Tags are editable only if you have the relevant task editing permissions.

searchDocs.title: Why is Workspace Important?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A workspace can help you:  Manage multiple projects on a single page.Avoid missing trivial or crucial information.Manage different departments or working areas independently.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Workspace‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Permission Set‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Assignment of Story Points is governed by the Edit Task permission set:  Edit All ‚Äì User can assign story points to any task/subtask.Edit Owned ‚Äì User can assign story points only to tasks/subtasks they own.Edit Related ‚Äì User can assign story points to tasks/subtasks linked to their projects.Edit None ‚Äì User cannot assign or edit story points.  Refer Roles and Permission for more details.

searchDocs.title: Access and Manage Story Points‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To use story points, the Story Points feature must be enabled from Project Settings ‚Üí Features ‚Üí Story Points.  Once enabled, the Story Points field will be available for all tasks and subtasks.  The field accepts numeric values, and there is no predefined limit on value range.  Story Points are independent between tasks and subtasks, and changes in one do not affect the other.

searchDocs.title: Add Story Points‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Task/Subtask Details‚Äã  Open the Task or Subtask Details panel.Locate the Story Points field.Enter a numeric value as per your sizing convention (e.g., 3, 5, 8, etc.).  List View / Board View‚Äã  If Story Points is not visible on the view, click Customize.Enable the Story Points field and adjust display order if necessary using drag and drop.Save the view.Locate the Story Points field for a task or subtask and enter the desired value.  My Work‚Äã  Navigate to My Work.Click on the desired task to open Task Details.Add the Story Points value as described above.  Bulk Update‚Äã  Select multiple tasks/subtasks from any list or board view.Click on Bulk Update from the action bar.Choose Story Points from the update options.Enter a numeric value.All selected tasks/subtasks will be updated with the entered story point value.

searchDocs.title: Quick Add (While Creating a Task)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: While creating a task using the Quick Add method, after entering the Name and Location, navigate to the Story Points field.Enter the numeric value.The story points will be saved along with the task.

searchDocs.title: Remove Story Points‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Task/Subtask Details‚Äã  Open the task/subtask detail page.Locate the Story Points field and clear the entered value.  List View / Board View‚Äã  If the field is visible, you can click and clear the story point value directly.  My Work‚Äã  Open the task from My Work.Access the Story Points field and remove the assigned value.  Quick Note  Story Points are commonly used in Agile and Scrum to measure relative effort.This is a numeric-only field and does not correlate directly with hours or days.Only users with the required permissions can assign or update Story Points.

searchDocs.title: Who can Manage‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, workspace management capabilities are controlled through user roles and permission sets. These define what each user can view, create, edit, or delete within the workspace environment.  Understanding these permissions ensures the right level of control is maintained across different user roles ‚Äî such as Admins, Managers, or Collaborators ‚Äî while keeping the workspace secure and structured.

searchDocs.title: Key Permission Types‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Permission Type	DescriptionView	Controls which workspaces user can view in the account. Add	Controls whether user is allowed to create new workspace. Edit	Controls the ability to manage and update workspace. Delete	Controls the ability to delete workspace  Each of these permissions has granular levels like All, Own, Related, or None depending on how much access a user should have.

searchDocs.title: Permission Levels‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Permission Level	DescriptionAll	Applies to all workspaces in the account, regardless of ownership or membership. Own	Applies only to workspaces where user is listed as the workspace owner. Related	Applies to workspaces where user is either the workspace owner or a workspace member. None	The user does not have any access for the selected action

searchDocs.title: Workspace Permission Matrix‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Type	All	Own	Related	NoneView	Can view all workspaces in the account	-	Can view only workspaces where you are workspace owner or workspace member	Cannot view any workspace Add	Can create new workspaces	-	-	Cannot create new workspace Edit	Can edit all workspaces	Can edit workspaces where you are workspace owner	Can edit workspaces where you are a member or owner	Cannot edit any workspace Delete	Can delete any workspace	Can delete only workspaces where you are workspace owner	Can delete workspaces where you are workspace owner or workspace member	Cannot delete any workspace  Note: ‚ÄúWorkspace Edit‚Äù permission grants access to modify the core settings of a workspace, including timesheets, workflows, and task types.

searchDocs.title: Best Practices‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Account Owner or Admins should have All permissions for full control.  Department heads or project managers can be given Own or Related permissions based on their roles in organization.  General team members should typically have None for sensitive actions like editing or deleting workspaces.  Ensure only limited users have Delete permissions to prevent accidental data loss.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Account Settings section in 5day.io is your organization‚Äôs central command hub. It‚Äôs where you manage and configure everything related to how your workspace functions ‚Äî from organizational identity to security, user access, and billing.  ‚úÖ Think of Account Settings as the control panel for everything organization-wide in 5day.io.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Account Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To access your organization‚Äôs account settings in 5day.io:  Click on your profile icon in the top or bottom navigation bar (depending on your layout).

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: From the dropdown menu, select Account Settings.In the menu, click on the General tab.Once you click on General, you will see your organization‚Äôs account settings page, where you can update your account name, description, logo, and other organizational-level details.  ‚úÖ Only users with the appropriate access (like Account Owner, Admin, or users with Account Settings manage-level permission) will be able to view or make changes here.  From here, you can navigate to other key settings like People, Security & Permissions, Integrations, Billing, and more.

searchDocs.title: Profile Section‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In the Profile section, the Account Owner can manage the organization‚Äôs identity and ownership settings.  User can:  Set Account Name ‚Äì Define or update the name of your organization as it will appear across the system.Add/Update Country ‚Äì Specify the country your organization is based in to.View Account URL ‚Äì See the unique URL assigned to your account.Add/Update Description ‚Äì Provide a description about your organization or how the account is used.Upload Organization Logo ‚Äì Add your organization's logo for better branding across the platform.View Account Owner Details ‚Äì See current account owner information.Change Account Owner ‚Äì Transfer ownership to another user if necessary.

searchDocs.title: Display Section‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In the Display section, the Account Owner can configure how the 5day.io environment looks and behaves for all users across the organization.  You can set:  Default Time Zone ‚Äì Set the standard time zone for your organization‚Äôs work.Default Language ‚Äì View the language for your account interface.Time Format ‚Äì Select 12-hour or 24-hour clock format.Date Format ‚Äì Choose how dates are displayed (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY).Duration Format ‚Äì Define how durations are displayed across worklogs and tasks: Clock (hh:mm) ‚Äì e.g., 5 hours 30 minutes ‚Üí 05:30Days (dd.dd) ‚Äì e.g., 2.5 days ‚Üí 2.50Days, Hours, Minutes (2d 5h 30m) ‚Äì e.g., 2 days 5 hours 30 minutes ‚Üí 2d 5h 30mHours (hh.hh) ‚Äì e.g., 5.5 hours ‚Üí 5.50Hours, Minutes (5h 30m) ‚Äì e.g., 5 hours 30 minutes ‚Üí 5h 30m Day Configuration‚Äì ‚Äì Define how many hours are considered a full working day. For example, if you set Day Configuration = 8h, then 8 hours will equal 1 full working day across timesheets.Skin (Theme) ‚Äì Choose a color scheme or theme for your account's look and feel.Layout ‚Äì Select between: Left Navigation (sidebar menu)Top Navigation (horizontal top bar menu)  These display preferences apply at the organizational level and affect the overall experience for all users inside the account.

searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Change the Account Owner
searchDocs.content: Under the Account Owner section, you will see the current account owner's name along with the option to Change Owner.Click on the Change Owner button.  You will now have two options:  Select from Existing Members: A list of all active members will appear. After selecting or inviting the new owner, confirm the change to complete the process.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Account Profile‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To access your Account Profile:  Click on your Profile Icon located at the bottom-left corner of the navigation panel.From the menu that appears, select Account Settings.Inside Account Settings, click on the General tab. IMAGE‚Äã Under General, you will find the option for Account Profile.Click on Account Profile to view and manage: Profile Settings (Account Name, Country, Description, Logo, etc.)Display Settings (Time Zone, Language, Layout, Theme, etc.)

searchDocs.title: Change the Organization Logo‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To change the organization logo in 5day.io, users need to go to their Account Profile.  Inside the Account Profile:  Click on the Display tab.In the Display tab, you will see the current Organization Logo. searchDocs.title: Create a Work Schedule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can create custom work schedules to define working hours, hybrid work models, and holidays for your team. You can either create a new schedule from scratch or duplicate an existing one to save time.

searchDocs.title: 1. Create a New Work Schedule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Work Schedule:\ IMAGE‚Äã Navigate to Account Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Work Schedule.Click on Add: Inside the Work Schedule section, click the Add button next to the list of existing work schedules to start creating a new one.Enter Work Schedule Name:\ IMAGE‚Äã Give your new work schedule a meaningful name (e.g., "Regular Working Hours" or "US Hybrid Team").Set as Default (Optional): Enable this option if you want this schedule to become the organization's default working schedule.Define Work Days and Settings: Start of Calendar Week: Choose between Monday or Sunday.Enable Hybrid Work: Assign work location (Home or Office) per day.Optionally allow members to update their hybrid working status manually. Enable or Disable Working Days: Select the days that are active (e.g., Monday‚ÄìFriday).Set Start and End Times: Define working hours for each active day.Set Daily Location (if Hybrid is Enabled): Choose Office or Home for each working day. Add Holidays: Switch to the Holidays tab.Click Add Holiday, and define the Holiday Name and Holiday Date. Auto-Save: As you set up your work schedule, all changes are automatically saved. No need to manually click any Save button.

searchDocs.title: 2. Duplicate an Existing Work Schedule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you already have a work schedule similar to the one you need, you can simply duplicate it and make changes instead of creating a new one from scratch.  Here‚Äôs how:  Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Work Schedule.Find the Schedule to Duplicate: Locate the existing work schedule you want to copy.Click the Three-Dot Menu (‚ãÆ):\ IMAGE‚Äã Next to the schedule name, click on the three dots.Select Duplicate: Click on the Duplicate option from the menu.Edit the Duplicated Work Schedule: The duplicated schedule will appear immediately.You can modify the work days, hours, hybrid settings, and holidays as needed.Update the Work Schedule Name to reflect the new schedule.  All edits are automatically saved as you make changes.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, the Data Import feature allows users to import people and tasks in bulk to save time and streamline onboarding or migration from other systems. Whether you're importing 10 users or 100, or migrating large task lists into projects ‚Äî the process is simple, efficient, and trackable.

searchDocs.title: What Can Be Imported?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: People Import: Add multiple users at once into your organization.Task Import: Bulk upload tasks into specific projects.

searchDocs.title: Edit a Work Schedule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Work Schedule.Select the Work Schedule to Edit:\ IMAGE‚Äã From the list of work schedules, click on the name of the work schedule you want to update.Make Your Changes: Inside the selected work schedule, you will find two sections: Work Days Tab: Update working days (enable/disable specific days).Change start and end times for any day.Adjust hybrid work settings or work locations if needed. Holidays Tab: Add new holidays.Edit existing holidays (update name or date).Remove holidays if required. Auto-Save: All changes you make are automatically saved in real time. You do not need to manually click any Save button.

searchDocs.title: Delete a Work Schedule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Work Schedule.Find the Work Schedule to Delete: In the list of work schedules, locate the one you want to remove.Click the Three-Dot Menu (‚ãÆ):\ IMAGE‚Äã Next to the work schedule name, click on the three-dot menu icon.Select Delete: From the dropdown menu, click on the Delete option.Confirm Deletion: A confirmation box will appear asking if you are sure you want to delete the work schedule. Click Yes to confirm.

searchDocs.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Note:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You cannot delete a work schedule if it is currently marked as the default work schedule.If you want to delete a default schedule, first set another work schedule as the default, and then delete the intended one.

searchDocs.title: Steps to Import People (Account Level)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Account Settings Navigate to the top menu and click Account Settings. Open Data Import History From the sidebar, click on Data Import History. IMAGE‚Äã Click + Import In the top-right, click the + Import button to start the import process. Select 'People' as Import Type A confirmation box will appear.Choose People as the data type you want to import. Download the Sample Template Click Download Sample File.The Excel file will contain: A Template sheet where you‚Äôll enter the people data (e.g., name, email, role).A Guidelines sheet explaining the format and allowed values. Fill Out the Template File Enter the necessary details in the Template sheet.Refer to the Guidelines sheet to ensure accuracy and completeness. Upload and Import the File Once your file is ready, return to the import window in 5day.io.Click Upload from computer, select your completed Excel file, and click Import.

searchDocs.title: After the Import‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Once the import is complete, the import record will appear in the Data Import History table with key information such as:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã

searchDocs.title: How to Import Tasks‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can import tasks in bulk to any project using a structured Excel template. This feature is especially useful when migrating tasks from spreadsheets or other tools.

searchDocs.title: Steps to Import Tasks (Account Level)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Account Settings Click on Data Import History from the sidebar. IMAGE‚Äã Click + Import A confirmation box will open. Choose Import Type and Project Select Task as the import type.Choose the Project where you want to import the tasks. Download the Sample File Click Download Sample File.The Excel file includes two sheets: Template: Where you‚Äôll enter your task data (e.g., title, description, due date, assignee).Guidelines: Reference sheet explaining each column in the template. Fill Out the Template File Open the file and input your tasks in the Template sheet.Use the Guidelines sheet for field formats and required values. Upload and Import the File Once your file is ready, return to the import window in 5day.io.In the import popup, click Upload from computer and select your filled Excel file.Click Import to start the import process.

searchDocs.title: After the Import‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Once the file is processed, you‚Äôll see it listed in the Data Import History table.  You‚Äôll be able to view:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Date and Time of importFile NameImported ByImport Type (Task)Status: (Completed or Failed)Total Records, Successful Imports, and Failed Records  If any records failed:  You can view the number of failed entries.Download the error file to see what went wrong and correct it.Re-upload the corrected file if needed.

searchDocs.title: Invite a New User‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Account Settings: Click on your Profile Icon and select Account Settings.Open People Section: Inside Account Settings, click on the People tab to manage users. IMAGE‚Äã Click on Invite New: In the People section, click on the Invite New button. Choose How to Invite: You will see two fields to fill: Invite by Email: Enter the email address of the user you want to invite to the 5day.io account.Select Role: Choose the appropriate Role for the user (e.g., Account Admin, Manager, Member, External Member, Guest) depending on the level of access they require. Send the Invitation: Once you have entered the email address and selected the role, click on Invite.Email Confirmation: The invited user will receive an email invitation to join 5day.io. They will need to accept the invitation and complete their account setup.User Added: After accepting the invitation, the user will officially be added to your 5day.io account and assigned the selected role.

searchDocs.title: By Default Access‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Account Owners and Account Admin with the default system role have full access to the Account Profile.They can view and manage all sections including Profile and Display settings.No other roles (Manager, Member, External Member, Guest) are allowed to access Account Profile by default.

searchDocs.title: Access via Custom Roles and Permissions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If your organization uses Custom Roles in 5day.io, access to the Account Profile can be configured through Global Permissions.  Within the Global Permission settings:  Under the Account Settings category, you will find three options: None ‚Äì User cannot view or access account profile.View ‚Äì User can only view the Account Profile (read-only access).Manage ‚Äì User can fully manage and update the Account Profile.  ‚úÖ If a user‚Äôs custom role has "Manage" permission enabled under Account Settings, they will be able to:  Access the Account ProfileEdit Account Profile details (Account Name, Country, Description, Logo, etc.)Edit Display settings (Time Zone, Language, Layout, Theme, etc.)

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The People section in 5day.io is where you manage all users within your organization‚Äôs account.  From the People section, you can:  Invite a New User ‚Äì Add new team members to your 5day.io account.View and Manage Profiles ‚Äì Access user profile information.Bulk Import Users ‚Äì Quickly upload multiple users at once through a bulk import feature.Remove Users ‚Äì Remove people who are no longer part of the organization.Search for Users ‚Äì Search users by Name, Email Address, or Account Role to quickly locate specific users.Filter Users ‚Äì Apply filters to view users based on: Status: Invited, Active, Inactive, Created.Account Role: Account Owner, Account Admin, Manager, Member, External Member, Guest. Sort Users ‚Äì Sort the list of users based on: NameEmail Address  All people management activities‚Äîadding, viewing, updating, and removing users‚Äîcan be performed easily from this section.

searchDocs.title: How to Access the People Section‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To access and manage the People section in 5day.io:  Go to Account Settings: Click on your Profile Icon and select Account Settings.Select People: IMAGE‚Äã Inside Account Settings, click on the People option from the sidebar.Manage Users: After entering the People section, you will be able to: Invite new membersView, edit, or deactivate user profilesPerform bulk importsRemove users if needed

searchDocs.title: Remove a User‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Account Settings: Click on your Profile Icon at the bottom-left (or top navigation bar) and select Account Settings.Open People Section: IMAGE‚Äã In Account Settings, click on the People tab to view all users added to your account.Locate the User to Remove: Browse the list of users and find the specific user you want to remove.Click the Three-Dot Menu (‚ãÆ): Next to the user‚Äôs name, click on the three-dot menu icon.Select Remove: IMAGE‚Äã From the dropdown options, click on Remove.Confirm Removal: A confirmation prompt will appear. searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, Work Schedule is a feature that allows organizations to define the working structure for their members. It helps set up workdays, working hours, and location preferences (such as office or home), creating a clear expectation for when and where team members are available.  With Work Schedule, you can customize:  Working daysStart and end timesHybrid work options (home or office)Calendar week start dayHolidaysMultiple work schedule options based on different needs (e.g., regular, hybrid, flexible)

searchDocs.title: Subscription Association‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Work Schedule feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io. However, the number of work schedules you can create depends on your subscription plan:  Subscription Plan	Work Schedule LimitFree Plan	Only Default Work Schedule is available Growth Plan	Unlimited Work Schedules can be created  Who Can Manage Work Schedule  Account Owners and Account Admins with the default system roles can access and manage Work Schedules.Custom Role Users: Users who have been granted Manage rights under Account Settings in Global Permissions can also create, edit, and manage Work Schedules.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Work Schedule‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Subscription Association‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Chart Type ‚Äì Doughnut Chart is available across all subscription plans.

searchDocs.title: Create Doughnut Chart‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To configure the Doughnut Chart in the Dashboard, follow these steps:  Navigate to the Dashboard module.Click on ‚ÄòAdd Widget‚Äô.Enter a name for the widget.Select ‚ÄòDoughnut Chart‚Äô from the available chart options.Adjust the configuration settings according to your preferences:  Choose whether to include subtasks or not.Set the Group By field (e.g., Task, User, Status, etc.).Select the Measure for calculating data distribution (e.g., Sum, Count, etc.).  Once configured, save your settings to view the updated Doughnut Chart.

searchDocs.title: Configuration of Doughnut Chart‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Doughnut Chart configuration is divided into two primary categories for setup:  Task: Visualizes task-related data.Timesheet: Focuses on timesheet entries and time-related data.  Here‚Äôs a detailed breakdown of the configuration settings for both charts:  Field Name	Settings	DescriptionBased On	Task and Subtask	Defines the dataset on which the doughnut chart will be produced. This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask	Yes/No	Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Group By	Category (e.g. User, Status, dates etc.)	Defines how the data will be grouped into different segments of the doughnut. Measure	Sum, Count of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID	Defines how the size of each segment will be calculated. Users can choose between Sum or Count based on the selected field. Sort	Label, Value	Defines how the segments should be ordered, either by label (name) or value (size). Order By	Ascending, Descending	Specifies the order in which segments are displayed in the chart.  Format of Doughnut Chart  The Format settings let you tweak how the Doughnut Chart looks and grabs attention. Play with it to highlight big slices or keep the whole thing neat.  Field Name	Settings	DescriptionShow Tooltip	Yes/No	Turn on to see a pop-up with exact values when you hover over a slice. Legend Position	None/Top/Bottom/Left/Right	Choose where the legend (color labels) sits around the doughnut. Color Picker	Color Selection	Pick custom colors for each slice‚Äîmake important ones stand out or match your team colors.

searchDocs.title: Configuration of Line Chart‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Line Chart configuration is divided into two primary categories for setup:  Task: Visualizes task-related data.Timesheet: Focuses on timesheet entries and time-related data.  Here‚Äôs a detailed breakdown of the configuration settings for both charts:  Field Name	Settings	DescriptionBased On	Task and Subtask	Defines the dataset on which the line chart will be produced. This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask	Yes/No	Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Group By	X-Axis (e.g. Date, User, Status etc.)	Defines the X-Axis on which the data will be plotted (e.g., by task status, assigned user, or date). Measure	Sum, Min, Max, Avg of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID	Defines how the data will be aggregated on the Y-Axis. Users can choose between Sum, Minimum, Maximum, or Average. Sort	Label, Value	Defines how the data should be sorted. Users can choose to sort based on the X-axis or Y-axis values. Order By	Ascending, Descending	Specifies the order in which the chart data should be displayed, either in ascending or descending order.  Format of Line Chart  The Format settings let you shape how the Pie Chart looks and pops. Tweak it to spotlight key slices or fit your vibe. searchDocs.title: Move Widget
searchDocs.content: Move Widget The Move Widget feature allows you to reposition widgets on your dashboard based on your layout preferences. To move a widget: Enable Edit mode by clicking the Edit Dashboard option.Hover over the widget you want to move.Drag the widget to your desired position on the dashboard.Release the widget to place it. The new position will be updated and auto-saved instantly. Quick NoteYou can rearrange multiple widgets easily to customize the dashboard view that best suits your project or team needs.

searchDocs.title: Why is Dashboard Important‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Dashboard is the command center of your project. It eliminates scattered data across tabs, emails, or spreadsheets by surfacing real-time metrics exactly where decisions are made.  Instant clarity: See project health, upcoming deadlines, and workload distribution at a glance- reducing status meetings by up to 40 %.Proactive risk detection: Spot overdue tasks, blocked dependencies, or budget overruns before they escalate.Team alignment: Every stakeholder - from PMs to executives - views the same live truth, fostering accountability and faster iterations.Focus over noise: Filter out irrelevant details and highlight only the KPIs that drive your delivery cycles.

searchDocs.title: Key features of Dashboard‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Drag-and-drop layout: Click and pull any widget to move it, or resize it.  Section-level dashboards: Each Section in a Project has its own Dashboard, and you can pick different widgets or layouts for each.  Real-time sync: Every task update, or date change shows up instantly on the widget.  Widget formatting: Change colors, pick chart styles, or switch between list and graph views inside any widget.

searchDocs.title: Refresh Dashboard
searchDocs.content: Refresh Dashboard Refreshing ensures that your dashboard displays the most up-to-date information from your projects and sections. 5day.io offers two ways to refresh the dashboard: Full Dashboard Refresh: Refresh the entire dashboard at once, updating all widgets simultaneously with the latest data. Individual Widget Refresh: Hover over a specific widget to reveal the Refresh icon. Clicking this icon will refresh only that widget, allowing you to update individual components without reloading the whole dashboard.

searchDocs.title: Resize Widget
searchDocs.content: Resize Widget The Resize Widget feature allows you to adjust the size of widgets to better fit your data visualization needs. To resize a widget: Enable Edit mode by clicking the Edit Dashboard option.Hover over the widget you want to resize.Drag the edges or corners of the widget to expand or collapse its size.Release once you achieve the preferred size. The new size will be auto-saved immediately. Quick NoteResizing is helpful for creating a cleaner and more organized dashboard, highlighting larger charts or minimizing widgets that require less space.

searchDocs.title: Key features of Widget‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Widget type: Choose from line chart, bar chart, doughnut chart, pie chart, number chart, or table. You can set up each one to show the exact data you need.  Filters: Narrow down what shows up - like only tasks for specific person, certain statuses, or due date range.  Custom Layout: Switch colors, flip between list or graph.  Refresh: Widgets update live as things change, or hit the refresh button if you want the latest right now.  Subscription limits: Add as many widgets as your plan allows; upgrade if you need more.
