searchDocs.title: Key Highlights‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Filters can be applied based on any field in 5day.io.Multiple filters can be combined to create complex conditions.Filters are dynamic and can be modified anytime without changing the underlying data.The widget refreshes instantly to reflect the filtered dataset.

searchDocs.title: Apply Filter‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to the Dashboard from Project Views.Create a new widget or edit an existing one.In the widget configuration panel, locate the Filters section.Click on Add Filter.Select any available field offered by 5day.io (e.g., Section, Assignee, Status, Date, Logged Hours, Tags, Custom Fields, etc.).Define the filter condition (e.g., equals, contains, greater than, less than, between, etc.).To add more conditions, click + Add Filter again.After configuring the filters, click Create Widget/Update Widget to apply them to your widget.  The widget will now display the data according to the applied filters.

searchDocs.title: How to Create a Client‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can easily create and manage clients at the account level to organize your projects better.

searchDocs.title: Steps to Create a Client:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Account Settings.Click on Clients from the sidebar.Click the + Add button at the top.In the form that appears: Enter the Client Name (mandatory).Upload a Client Logo (optional). Once you enter the details, the client will be automatically created and listed under the Clients section.  ‚úÖ The new client is now available and can be linked to one or more projects within your account.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, the Clients feature allows you to manage and track the companies or organizations you are working with. Clients are maintained at the tenant level, meaning they are available across all projects within your account.  Adding clients helps you:  Track how many projects are associated with each client.Monitor the number of Active Projects (projects still in progress).Get a complete view of your Total Projects for each client.

searchDocs.title: How to Edit a Client‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can easily edit client information, such as the client name and logo, to keep your records up to date.

searchDocs.title: Steps to Edit a Client:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to Account Settings.Click on Clients from the sidebar.You will see a list of all existing clients.Find the client you want to edit.To edit the Client Name: Click directly on the client‚Äôs name.The name field will become editable.Update the name as needed. To edit or change the Client Logo: Hover over the current logo.Click on Remove Logo.Once removed, an Upload Logo option will appear.Upload the new logo.  ‚úÖ Changes to the client‚Äôs name or logo are automatically saved once updated.

searchDocs.title: Task Widgets‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Task Widgets allow you to visualize the status, progress, and distribution of tasks within a project or section.  These widgets help you track overdue tasks, monitor task priorities, view completion rates, and many more.  You can use various chart types like Pie Charts, Bar Charts, Line Charts, doughnut Charts, Number Charts and Table views.  Bar Chart for Tasks: Displays task data using horizontal or vertical bars to easily compare quantities across different categories.  Line Chart for Tasks: Shows task trends over time by connecting data points with a continuous line, ideal for tracking progress.  Pie Chart for Tasks: Represents task distribution as slices of a circle, helping visualize proportions of different statuses or priorities.  Doughnut Chart for Tasks: A circular chart similar to a pie chart, but with a hollow center, offering a cleaner look for task breakdowns.  Number Chart for Tasks: Highlights a key metric as a single, bold number ‚Äî like total tasks, completed tasks, or overdue tasks.  Table view for Tasks: Organizes task details in a structured table format for easy sorting, filtering, and comparison.

searchDocs.title: Time Entry Widgets‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Timesheet Widgets focus on time tracking and work hours logged by team members.  These widgets help you monitor billable hours, non-billable efforts, and overall team utilization effectively.  Popular chart types for Timesheet Widgets include Bar Charts, Pie Charts, and Summary Tables.  Bar Chart for Time Entries - A visual representation of time entries using horizontal or vertical bars to compare different time data.  Line Chart for Time Entries - A chart that displays time entries as data points connected by lines, showing trends over a period.  Pie Chart for Time Entries - A circular chart divided into sectors representing the proportion of time entries relative to a whole.  Doughnut Chart for Time Entries - A variation of the pie chart with a central hole, used to display the percentage distribution of time entries.  Number Chart for Time Entries - A chart that shows the total or specific numerical value of time entries, typically represented in large numbers.  Table view for Time Entries - A tabular representation of time entries with rows and columns, providing detailed data in a structured format.

searchDocs.title: Sprint Widgets‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Sprint Widgets are designed to track sprint progress, team velocity, and sprint goals for agile teams.  These widgets are ideal for monitoring real-time agile delivery performance during a sprint.  There are three key Sprint Widget types available:  Sprint Burn Up Chart: Shows completed work compared to the total scope.  Sprint Burn Down Chart: Displays remaining work over the sprint timeline.  Velocity Chart: Visualizes the amount of work completed sprint-over-sprint.  Quick NoteSprint charts are available at the Project Dashboard only and are not available at the Section Dashboard.

searchDocs.title: How to Delete a Client‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can delete a client if it is no longer needed in your system. Steps to Delete a Client:  Go to Account Settings.Click on Clients from the sidebar.You will see a list of all the clients created.Find the client you want to delete.Click on the three-dot menu (‚ãÆ) next to the client's name.Select Delete from the dropdown options.A confirmation box will appear asking for final confirmation.Click Confirm to proceed with deleting the client.  Important Notes:  If a client is associated with any project, it cannot be deleted. You must first remove or reassign the associated projects before deleting the client.Deleting a client is permanent and cannot be undone.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The My Settings page in 5day.io allows you to manage your personal preferences and profile settings, helping tailor the platform to your individual work style.  From this page, you can:  View and update your profile and time zone informationView and switch your assigned work scheduleManage your notification preferencesChange your passwordView all organizations (accounts) you're linked to and switch between them if needed  ‚úÖ This section ensures you have full control over how you work inside 5day.io, no matter how many teams or organizations you're a part of.

searchDocs.title: How to Access My Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To access your personal settings in 5day.io:  Click on your profile icon from the top or bottom navigation bar (depending on your layout).From the dropdown menu, select My Settings.In the My Settings menu, you‚Äôll see various options such as: ProfileNotificationsSecurityWork ScheduleMore Click on any section you‚Äôd like to update directly, or select More to view the full list of available settings.  ‚úÖ This gives you access to all your personal preferences and allows you to update them at any time.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you‚Äôre part of multiple organizations using 5day.io, the 5day Accounts section helps you manage your presence across them. You can view:  A list of all the accounts you‚Äôre part ofYour role in each accountThe option to leave an account if needed  This is especially helpful for users who collaborate with multiple organizations.

searchDocs.title: How to Access 5day Accounts‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click on your profile icon and select My Settings.In the My Settings menu, click on 5day Accounts. IMAGE‚Äã You‚Äôll now see a list of all the accounts you're part of, along with your assigned role.To leave an account: Click on the three-dot menu next to the account you want to exit.Select Leave Account and confirm your action.

searchDocs.title: How to Change Your Password‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you‚Äôd like to update your login password, follow these steps:  Click on your profile icon and select My Settings from the dropdown.In the My Settings menu, go to Password and Security. IMAGE‚Äã Under the Change Password section, click on the Change Password button.A form will appear where you need to enter: Your current passwordYour new passwordConfirm your new password Click on Change Password to save the changes.  ‚úÖ Once updated, your new password will take effect immediately.

searchDocs.title: Steps to Edit Your Profile:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click on your profile icon in the navigation bar and go to My Settings.Select Profile from the My Settings menu.You‚Äôll see two tabs: Profile ‚Äî for personal detailsDisplay ‚Äî for appearance and layout preferences  From here, you can make the following changes:  Under the Profile tab: First Name, Last NamePhone NumberEmail AddressDate of BirthProfile Picture Under the Display tab: Time ZoneTime Format (12h or 24h)Date FormatDuration FormatTheme (Light or Dark)Layout (Left or Top navigation)  ‚úÖ All updates are saved automatically as soon as you make changes ‚Äî no manual save is required.

searchDocs.title: How to Enable or Disable Notifications‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, your notification settings give you full control over what updates you want to be alerted for ‚Äî and how. You can choose to receive notifications through Email, Web, or Mobile for specific actions that matter to you.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Notification Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click on your profile icon in the top or bottom navigation bar.Select My Settings from the dropdown.Click on the Notifications tab.  From here, you‚Äôll be able to enable or disable individual notifications based on your role, activity, and preferences.

searchDocs.title: Notification Categories & Events‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here‚Äôs what each category covers:  Projects‚Äã  Projects I am an Owner Get notified for all updates in a project you own.This includes changes to status, priority, dates, progress, or when someone is added to the project.  Tasks‚Äã  Tasks Assigned to Me New task is assigned to youAssignee is changedTask is deletedTask is moved to another section or projectOther task updates (e.g., status, priority, type, dates) Tasks Created by Me When tasks you‚Äôve created are deleted or movedOther task updates in the ones you‚Äôve created  Comments‚Äã  When someone replies to your commentNew comments in tasks/subtasks assigned to youNew comments in tasks/subtasks you createdWhen someone @mentions you  Timesheet‚Äã  Reminder to submit your timesheetReminder for pending timesheetsReminder to log your timesheet  Reminders‚Äã  All general reminders based on your task due dates, timesheets, and project settings

searchDocs.title: How to Configure‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Each row has toggles for:  EmailWebMobile  Simply check or uncheck the boxes to enable or disable the notification types you prefer.  ‚úÖ Changes are saved instantly when you toggle a notification.

searchDocs.title: Do Not Disturb (DND) Mode‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use this feature to automatically silence notifications during specific hours or on your days off.  To enable Do Not Disturb mode:  Go to My Settings from your profile menu.Click on Notifications.Under the Schedule section, check the box for ‚ÄúDo not notify me from:‚Äù.Set your preferred start and end time for the DND period.Select the days you want DND to apply (e.g., Saturday, Sunday). Selected days will be highlighted.  To disable Do Not Disturb mode:  Uncheck the ‚ÄúDo not notify me from‚Äù box to remove the time-based restriction.To remove any selected days, click on each highlighted day again to deselect it.

searchDocs.title: Pause Notifications‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use this option to temporarily silence all notifications across devices.  To pause notifications:  In the same Notifications section under My Settings,Click the ‚ÄúPause notifications‚Äù button. Once active, it will be highlighted.  To resume notifications:  Click the ‚ÄúPause notifications‚Äù button again to turn it off.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Notifications‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To manage your notifications in 5day.io:  Click on your profile icon in the top or bottom navigation bar (based on your layout).From the dropdown, select My Settings.Inside My Settings, click on the Notifications tab.  From here, you‚Äôll be able to:  Enable or disable notifications for tasks, projects, comments, reminders, and timesheets.Choose where you want to receive updates ‚Äî Web, Email, or Mobile.Configure Do Not Disturb or Pause Notifications to control when and how you get notified.  This gives you full control over your notification preferences.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Profile section inside My Settings in 5day.io lets users manage their personal information and tailor how the application looks and behaves ‚Äî all in one place. It‚Äôs designed to give every user full control over their identity settings and display preferences.  The Profile settings are organized into two parts:

searchDocs.title: 1. Profile‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In this section, users can update their personal details, including:  First Name and Last NamePhone NumberEmail AddressDate of BirthProfile Picture (upload or change)  This helps keep your identity accurate across all your 5day.io workspaces and collaborations.

searchDocs.title: 2. Display‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Display tab allows users to customize how 5day.io appears and functions for them, including:  Time Zone: Set your local working time zoneTime Format: Choose between 12-hour or 24-hour formatsLanguage: Default is English (currently fixed)Date Format: Choose how dates are displayed (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY)Duration Format: Define how durations (like work hours) are displayedTheme: Choose a light or dark mode to personalize your experienceLayout: Decide where the navigation menu should appear ‚Äî Left Navigation or Top Navigation  ‚úÖ Everything you configure here applies only to your personal account experience and is visible only to you.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Work Schedule section in 5day.io allows users to view the working hours and holiday calendar assigned to them by their organization. By default, each user is assigned an organization-defined work schedule, which outlines their working days, daily start and end times. It also displays the start of the calendar week, the total daily working duration, and the holiday list for the current year.  If this assigned schedule doesn‚Äôt reflect a user's actual working pattern, they can easily switch to another work schedule from a list of options configured by their organization.

searchDocs.title: How to Change Your Work Schedule‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, your organization assigns a default work schedule, but if it doesn‚Äôt align with your actual working hours, you have the flexibility to change it.

searchDocs.title: Steps to Change Your Work Schedule:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to My Settings by clicking your profile icon in the navigation bar.From the menu, select Work Schedule.On the Work Schedule page, click the Change button.A list of all available work schedules set by your organization will appear.Select the schedule that matches your working pattern.  ‚úÖ Once selected, the new work schedule will be automatically applied to your profile.

searchDocs.title: Subscription Association
searchDocs.content: "My Work" is your personal command center inside 5day.io. It gathers all the tasks and subtasks assigned to you across projects into a single, organized view. This ensures that you always know what needs your attention, without switching between multiple boards or projects. Accessible to every user, My Work helps you stay focused, prioritize better, and manage your daily workload efficiently. Subscription Association My Work is available across all subscription plans of 5day.io without any restrictions. Who can Access All users can access My Work, irrespective of their role (Admin, Manager, Member, Guest, etc.). Upon clicking, you will be automatically redirected to the My Work page. The Home icon serves as the fastest way to view your personal task dashboard. My Work Categories Each task within My Work is automatically categorized based on its due date. The number of tasks in each category will be displayed in the header for quick reference. Overdue Tasks and subtasks assigned to you that have missed their due date but are still incomplete. This category highlights urgent actions that require immediate attention to stay on track. Today Tasks and subtasks that are due today or are scheduled for completion today. Use this category to plan your daily activities and meet immediate deadlines. Tomorrow Tasks and subtasks that are scheduled for tomorrow, giving you a clear preview of what's next. This helps you prepare in advance for the coming day and organize your work proactively. Upcoming Tasks and subtasks planned for the next 7 days (after tomorrow) are grouped under Upcoming. This view helps you keep an eye on your medium-term workload and plan ahead effectively. Unscheduled Tasks and subtasks that are assigned to you but have no due date yet. Use this category to identify pending work that needs to be prioritized and scheduled. Features on My Work Along with task visibility, My Work offers powerful utilities to help you manage and organize your workload even better. Search Quickly search through your list of tasks and subtasks by typing keywords. Filter Narrow down your task list by applying specific filters like project name, priority, status, task type, and more. Group By Organize your tasks visually by grouping them by period, status, task type, or priority. Sort Arrange tasks or subtasks in ascending or descending order based on due dates, priorities, status, task type and more. ‚úÖ Pro Tip: Use My Work as your daily starting point to stay organized, prioritize important tasks, and never miss a deadline.

searchDocs.content: Global permissions control access to account-wide administrative areas like Settings, People Management, Billing, Security, Integrations, and Custom Fields. Permission Type Options	Description View (All / View Related) View All	Allows the user to view all items across the account. View Related	Allows the user to view only items where they are directly assigned or associated (e.g., as Workspace Owner, Project Owner, or Task Assignee). Add Checkbox (Allow/Not Allow) Allows the user to create new items (e.g., Workspaces, Projects, Tasks, Timesheets). Delete (All / Owned / Related / None) Delete All Allows the user to delete any item across the workspace. Delete Owned Allows the user to delete any item where they are assigned as the Owner of that item. Delete Related Allows the user to delete items where they are assigned. None The user cannot delete any items. Other (Specific to certain features) Move (for Projects and Tasks) Allows the user to move a Project between Spaces and a Task between Projects or Sections. searchDocs.title: Day View (Timesheet)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Day View in 5day.io Timesheet allows you to see time entries laid out in a familiar hourly calendar format. It‚Äôs designed to help you visualize how your team is spending time throughout the day.

searchDocs.title: What You Can See‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A vertical timeline from 00:00 to 24:00, showing all hours in a day.All logged time entries for the selected date appear as blocks on the timeline.A summary section will be shown.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can click and drag on any time block (e.g., 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM) to log new time.This opens the Add Time Entry pop-up, where you can enter task, duration, notes, and select billable/non-billable.

searchDocs.content: By default, users only see their own time entries.Admins, Project Managers, or users with appropriate permissions can: Change the user from the ‚ÄúShowing for‚Äù dropdownView time entries for other team members

searchDocs.title: Additional Options‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people.Filter: Filter entries by Budget Type (Billable / Non-Billable).Change the Day: Navigate to past or upcoming days using the left/right arrow buttons at the top.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, users can directly add time for any task from within its Task Details view. This method is especially useful when you‚Äôre already reviewing or updating a task and want to capture time without switching views.  Within the task, you‚Äôll find two main ways to track your time:  Add Time ManuallyStart a Timer  Both options are available at the bottom bar of the task details interface.

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can log your time manually by clicking the ‚ûï Add Time icon in the task details view. This will open the standard Time Entry Form in the Task tab.  From here, you can:  Select either Duration (drag to set hours) or Time Range (enter start and end time)Confirm the Project and TaskChoose whether the time is Billable or Non-BillableAdd any relevant NotesClick Add to save the time entry  üìé Want to know more about the Time Entry Form?

searchDocs.title: Option 2: Start Timer‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you'd rather let the system track time for you:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click the ‚ñ∂ Start Timer icon at the bottom of the taskThe timer begins immediately and will keep running in the backgroundContinue working on your task ‚Äî the timer remains active as long as the tab is openOnce finished, return to the task and click the ‚ñ† Stop Timer buttonThe tracked time will be automatically logged under your name for that task

searchDocs.title: Viewing Logged Time‚Äã
searchDocs.content: After time is logged (whether manually or via timer), you can view all related entries by clicking the Time Logged field beside the task‚Äôs timer bar. This provides a breakdown of all time tracked for that task, including:  Date of entryHours and minutes loggedUser who logged the timeBillable or non-billable time entry

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Bulk Time Entry feature in 5day.io allows users to log time for multiple days in one go, making it easier to catch up on time tracking for past or future dates. This is especially useful for logging time on recurring tasks or internal activities like meetings, planning, or documentation.  Bulk Time Entry supports both project-based time entries and internal time logging ‚Äî all within a unified, calendar-style view.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Bulk Time Entry‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can access the Bulk Time Entry form from two locations:  From a Project Go to a Project where you have access.Click on the Timesheet tab. IMAGE‚Äã In the top-right corner, click on the Add Bulk Time button. From My Timesheet Navigate to My Timesheet from the left sidebar. IMAGE‚Äã Click on Add Bulk Time from the top-right of the timesheet view.  ‚úÖ You must have timesheet access enabled for the project or workspace to use this feature.

searchDocs.title: How Bulk Time Entry Works‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Once you open the Bulk Time Entry modal, you will see:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A weekly calendar view (Monday to Sunday).A user switcher (visible only if you have rights to log time for others).A list of added tasks or internal time categories with input fields beside each date.  You can enter time in hh:mm format directly into the date fields.

searchDocs.title: Add Task‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click + Add Task.Select the Project and Task for which you want to log time.Click Add.  Once added, the task appears as a row in the calendar view, and you can enter time for any day of the week.

searchDocs.content: Click + Add Internal Time.Select the Workspace (auto-filled based on context).Choose the Internal Time Category (e.g., Meetings, Training).Click Add.  The category will be listed with empty time fields next to each day, ready for entry.  ‚ÑπÔ∏è Internal time entries are used to capture non-project hours like internal meetings or activities.

It‚Äôs ideal for getting a quick snapshot of how much time has been logged by each member and across which tasks.  What You Can Do in List View‚Äã  Member-wise Summary: Shows each member's name with their total time logged during the selected week.Clicking on a member row expands the list of tasks against which time has been logged. Task Details: For each user, a detailed list of tasks is shown with individual time logs beside them. Week Navigation: The current week is selected by default.Navigate to past or upcoming weeks using the left/right arrow buttons at the top. Search & Filter: Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people.Filter by Budget Type (Billable or Non-Billable) using the top-right filter icon. searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: My Timesheet in 5day.io gives every user a centralized view to track their time logged across projects ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs billable hours, internal work, or time off. It‚Äôs designed to help both individuals and managers get a clear picture of time utilization and stay aligned on productivity goals.  From this single interface, users can:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Log time entries using the Add Time or Add Bulk Time buttonsSwitch between multiple views: Day, Week, Month, and ListSee logged entries by type ‚Äì Time Entry, Internal Time, and Time OffSearch: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people.Group data in List View by Project or Member to easily understand where time is going  Users can only view and manage their own time entries by default. However, admins, project managers, or users with permission can change the "Showing for" dropdown to see entries for a specific member or all members.  In the List View, additional flexibility is provided:  Group by Project: View a breakdown of your timesheet entries across each projectGroup by Member (for managers): View all entries submitted by each team member  Managers can also access the Time Approval tab to review and approve timesheets across different projects, depending on permissions and workspace settings.  Whether you're an individual contributor keeping track of your hours, or a manager reviewing timesheets for approvals ‚Äî My Timesheet keeps everything organized, clear, and easy to act on.

Admins, project managers, or users with the appropriate permissions can switch views to see time entries for other members across Day, Week, Month, or List view.  For details on each view (including how to log time, use filters, and read summaries), refer to the [Timesheet View Guide].

searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, when time approval is enabled for a project, admins, project managers, or users with the appropriate permissions can approve or reject time entries submitted by members.  You can manage time approvals in two ways:

To approve or reject: Enter the desired approved time (if you want to adjust)Click ‚úÖ to approveClick ‚ùå to reject This is especially useful for reviewing or modifying individual entries quickly.

searchDocs.title: üîî Notes‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Time Approval Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Time Approval feature in 5day.io allows organizations to implement a manual approval workflow for timesheet entries submitted by team members. When enabled, this feature ensures that all time logs must be reviewed and approved by project managers, admins, or users with the appropriate permission set before they are finalized.  Once time approval is enabled for a project, members can continue logging time against their tasks. However, those entries will remain in a pending state until reviewed. Approvers will have the option to approve or reject individual time entries or approve all entries in bulk for a project or specific member.  Team members can still see the approval status of their entries and resubmit or modify time logs based on feedback, depending on the workspace settings.  This approval process adds a layer of oversight and accuracy to project time tracking‚Äîensuring that only validated hours are included in reports, billing, and utilization.  Key Highlights:‚Äã  Time Approval must be enabled per project in Project Settings > Features.Only users with the "Approve Timesheet" permission (admins, project managers, or custom role users) can approve or reject timesheets.Approvers can manually enter or adjust the approved hours for each time entry while reviewing it. This is done in the 'Approved' column provided alongside the logged hours for each date. This allows approvers to validate and confirm how much of the submitted time is accepted.Members can view their approval status and update or resubmit entries if permitted.Approved timesheet entries are visible across My Timesheet and Project Timesheet views for both members and approvers.

Time Approval will be activated for this project.To disable: Switch the toggle OFF. Time entries will no longer require approval.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, timesheet-related functionalities such as time entry, tracking, and approval can be configured at the project level based on your team's needs. These features provide flexibility in how you want to manage and track work hours across different types of projects ‚Äî whether client-based, internal, or billable/non-billable.  By default, the following features are typically enabled:  Project Finance ‚Äì For tracking billable and non-billable hours, budgets, and profitability.Time Estimates ‚Äì To set time estimates per task and manage expected workload.Time Tracking ‚Äì To log actual hours spent on tasks manually or via timers.  Additional timesheet features such as Time Approval, Overtime, and Assignee Wise Estimation can be turned on or off as needed.  These settings are only visible to users with permission to manage project settings ‚Äî typically Project Managers, Account Admins, or users with custom roles granted access to this section.

searchDocs.title: How to Access Timesheet Features for a Project‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To enable or disable timesheet-related features for a project:  Go to the Project where you want to configure timesheet settings.Click on the three-dot menu (‚ãÆ) next to the project name and select Project Settings. IMAGE‚Äã In the left sidebar, click on Features.Scroll to see all available features such as: Time-related features like Time Tracking, Time Estimates, Time Approval, Overtime, Assignee Wise Estimation, etc. Use the toggle switches next to each feature to turn them on or off.

searchDocs.title: Configure Timesheet Features in a Project‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In 5day.io, you can customize which timesheet-related features should be enabled at the project level to suit the specific tracking needs of your team.

searchDocs.title: Default Enabled Features‚Äã
searchDocs.content: By default, the following timesheet features are turned on in every project:  Project Finance ‚Äì Track billable, non-billable hours, project budgets, and profitability.Time Estimates ‚Äì Set and manage estimated hours for each task.Time Tracking ‚Äì Log actual time spent on tasks manually or via timer.  These features offer a solid baseline for basic time management.

searchDocs.title: Optional Features (Enable as Needed)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The following additional features are available but disabled by default. Project Managers or users with permission can enable or disable them at any time using the toggle switches.  ‚úÖ Time Approval‚Äã  Enforces a formal approval process for submitted timesheets.Once enabled, project managers or approvers must approve time entries before they're finalized.  ‚è± Overtime‚Äã  Allows users to log hours worked beyond their regular schedules.Useful for capturing extra billable/non-billable time during crunch periods.  Assignee-Wise Estimation‚Äã  Allows task estimations to be divided among multiple assignees.Once this feature is enabled, a confirmation prompt appears asking how you‚Äôd like the estimation to be handled: Equally divide the estimation by person, orDisable equal division, allowing manual input of effort per assignee.

searchDocs.title: Time Entry Form Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Time Entry Form in 5day.io provides a unified interface to log time across different use cases ‚Äî whether you're tracking time on tasks, logging internal efforts (like meetings or reviews), or recording time off (such as sick leave or vacation).  Although this form can be accessed from multiple locations ‚Äî like Quick Add, My Timesheet, or directly from a task ‚Äî the layout remains consistent. The form is structured into three tabs, each designed for a specific time logging scenario:  Task ‚Äì For logging time against a task that‚Äôs assigned to youInternal Time ‚Äì For logging time not tied to tasks, such as internal meetingsTime Off ‚Äì For logging non-working time such as sick leave or vacation  Note: The options shown may vary slightly depending on where you access the form. For example, accessing from a task will only show the Task tab.  Across all tabs, the user can choose how to log time:  Duration ‚Äì Total hours worked (e.g., 2h)Time Range ‚Äì Specific start and end times (e.g., 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM)  This form ensures a consistent time logging experience across your workspace, while adapting to the type of time entry you want to make.

searchDocs.content: The Task tab in the Time Entry form allows you to log hours against a specific task in a project. This is ideal for tracking time spent on deliverables, meetings, or any billable/non-billable task work.  How It Works‚Äã  There are two ways to log time under the Task tab:  1. Duration Mode‚Äã  Use the slider to drag and select the number of hours worked.The Time Logged field will auto-calculate based on the slider position.  2. You can switch between these modes using the Duration or Time Range buttons.  Fields in the Task Tab‚Äã  Field	DescriptionTime Logged	Displays the total duration of the time entry. searchDocs.title: Rich Text Editor‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Rich Text Editor in 5day.io provides a powerful and flexible way for users to create well-formatted, professional content across the platform.  Whether you are writing a task description, adding a discussion message, or updating a document, the Rich Text Editor offers an extensive range of formatting tools to enhance your writing experience.  Users can easily apply text formatting (such as bold, italics, underline), insert lists, quotes, and code blocks, and add advanced elements like links, videos, and emojis.  Additionally, options like text direction, font size adjustment, background highlights, and cleaning formatting help maintain a clean and structured layout.  The editor supports both basic and advanced editing needs, making collaboration and communication within 5day.io more effective and visually organized.

searchDocs.title: Access Rich Text Editor‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Whenever you are editing a text field (like Task Description or Discussion), the Rich Text Editor toolbar will be available on top.To access advanced features, click on the dropdown (...) to open the Rich Text Menu.Hover over each option to view a tooltip describing its functionality.

searchDocs.title: List of Features‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Below are the features available in the Rich Text Editor:  Feature	DescriptionBold	Make your selected text bold for emphasis. Italic	Italicize your text to highlight or differentiate content. Underline	Underline important parts of your text. Strikethrough	Strike through text to show completed or obsolete items. Bullet List	Create a bulleted list for better organization of points. Number List	Create a numbered list for sequential information. Blockquote	Add a quotation block to highlight key quotes or references. Code Block	Insert a block specifically for code snippets or technical content. Subscript	Add subscript text for chemical formulas or technical data (e.g., H‚ÇÇO). Superscript	Add superscript text for footnotes or mathematical notations (e.g., x¬≤). Indent	Indent text to the right to structure the document better. Outdent	Remove an indent to adjust the text back towards the left. Text Direction	Change the direction of text, useful for right-to-left languages. Font Size	Adjust the font size (increase or decrease) of your text. Header	Insert header styles (H1, H2, H3, etc.) to structure the content into sections. Link	Insert a hyperlink to direct users to an external or internal page. Video	Embed a video by adding a video link. Color	Change the text color to emphasize specific words or sections. Background	Highlight text by changing its background color. Clean	Remove any formatting applied to selected text and return it to default style. Undo	Revert your last action or change made in the editor. Redo	Reapply an action that was undone.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Views in 5day.io help you organize and visualize your project tasks in the way that works best for you and your team.  Whether you're reviewing a long list of tasks or managing work through visual stages, 5day.io supports multiple powerful ways to interact with your project:  List View ‚Äì See all tasks in a structured list format.Board View ‚Äì View tasks as cards and drag them across stages (like ‚ÄúNew,‚Äù ‚ÄúIn Progress,‚Äù and ‚ÄúDone‚Äù).Timesheet View ‚Äì Track time entries across days, weeks, or months.Dashboard ‚Äì Analyze work through prebuilt reports and widgets.Files View ‚Äì Store, upload, and manage project files.Discussion View ‚Äì Start and reply to conversations around the project.Activity Stream ‚Äì View a real-time feed of all project changes.  These views are project-specific and tightly integrated with your workflows. Users with project settings access can customize views to suit their needs.

searchDocs.title: List View:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The List View helps you see all project tasks in a clean, table-like layout ‚Äî ideal for teams that prefer a structured, spreadsheet-style view of their work.¬†What You Can Do in List View¬†  View Tasks All tasks within a project are listed clearly for quick access and overview.¬†Add Tasks Use the Add Task button to create new tasks directly within the view.¬†Search Tasks Quickly locate tasks by name, task ID, task type, status, priority, or custom field values.¬†Filter Tasks Apply filters to narrow down your view by: Assignee¬†Status¬†Task Type¬†Priority¬†Tags¬†Section Sort Tasks Organize tasks by: Name¬†Due Date¬†Created On¬†Start Date¬†Last Updated¬†Priority Group By View tasks grouped by: Section¬†Status¬†Assignee¬†Priority¬†Task Type¬†Tags¬†None (Or no grouping) Customize View Choose which fields you want to display. You can: Toggle on/off fields like Estimated Time, Task Type, Tags, etc.¬†Rearrange column order (move fields up/down)¬†If Custom Fields are enabled in the project, you can also create a new custom field from within this panel.¬†

searchDocs.title: Actions in List View¬†‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In List View, you can personalize how tasks appear and behave by accessing the action menu (‚ãÆ three-dot icon) in the top right corner of the view. Here are the available actions:¬†  Show Completed Tasks¬†‚Äã Toggle this on to display all tasks that are marked as completed. Show Completed Subtasks¬†‚Äã Enable this to see all completed subtasks within your tasks. Save View Changes¬†‚Äã If you've customized your List View (e.g., using filters, sorting, grouping, or customize), click this to save the layout and preferences. This saved view is user-specific ‚Äî changes are stored for your account only. Reset to Default View¬†‚Äã Restore the List View to its original, default settings ‚Äî helpful if you want to discard customizations. Set as Default View¬†‚Äã Set your current List View configuration as the default view whenever you return to the project. This is also saved per user. Show Completed Sections¬†‚Äã Turn this on to display any sections within the project that have been marked as completed.¬†

searchDocs.title: Overview of Timesheet View‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Timesheet View in 5day.io allows users to manage, record, and visualize time logged across all their projects in one place. It provides a centralized space for individuals and teams to track working hours, analyze utilization, and ensure accurate time reporting for billable and non-billable work.  Timesheet View offers two main sections ‚Äî Timesheet and Time Approval ‚Äî that appear side by side at the top of the screen.  Timesheet is where users can add, edit, and view their logged hours in multiple time-based layouts such as Day, Week, Month, and List.Time Approval is available only if the project has timesheet approval enabled. Here, authorized users can review and approve submitted timesheets for their team members.  Each view (Day, Week, Month, and List) presents logged time in a different format to suit different needs. Users can switch between views with a single click, making it easy to see daily breakdowns, weekly summaries, or monthly overviews of time logged across tasks and projects.  Alongside these views, users can search or filter entries based on task name, task ID, member, status, or billable type. This helps refine data visibility and focus on specific details, such as pending approvals or billable time entries.

searchDocs.title: Key Features of Timesheet View:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Timesheet View in 5day.io is designed to give users complete control and flexibility when tracking their working hours. It includes essential tools to log, review, and analyze time entries efficiently, ensuring teams stay aligned and accountable.

searchDocs.title: Add Time / Add Bulk Time‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Users can log hours using two simple options:  Add Time: Used to record a single time entry for a specific day.Add Bulk Time: Allows entering time entries for multiple days in one go.

searchDocs.title: Timesheet‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Users can switch between four distinct views to manage and analyze logged time:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Day View: Displays a detailed, hour-by-hour breakdown of all entries for a single day.Week View: Provides a summary of time logged for each day of the week.Month View: Shows total time logged across the entire month.List View: Presents a detailed table with all logged hours for members within the project.  Each view adapts to different use cases ‚Äî from daily time tracking to long-term utilization review.

searchDocs.title: Calendar Widget‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Calendar Widget helps users navigate across days, weeks, or months depending on the selected view:  In Day View, users can select a specific date.In Week View, users can select a specific week.In Month View, users can select a specific month.In List View, users can select a week to see all entries within that duration.  In Time Approval, the calendar defaults to the current week for easy review of team submissions.

searchDocs.title: Showing For‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In Showing For, users can view their own timesheet or select other members if they have permission. The option to view All Members is available only in List View.

searchDocs.title: Search‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use the search bar in any view to quickly locate entries by Task ID, Task Name, or People. This helps users find relevant time logs without scrolling through multiple records.

searchDocs.title: Filter‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Apply filters to focus on specific types of time entries:  Status: All, To Submit, Pending Approval, Approved, or Rejected.Billable Type: Billable or Non-Billable.  Filtering helps narrow results for better review and reporting accuracy.

searchDocs.title: Time Summary Metrics‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Users can instantly view important time statistics through three key metrics:  Total Logged: Displays total logged hours versus total allocated capacity (for example, 5h/9h).Pending to Log: Shows the remaining hours that are yet to be logged.Utilization: Shows the percentage of hours logged against the total allocated capacity.  These insights help users and managers evaluate productivity and ensure balanced workloads.

searchDocs.title: Time Approval‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If time approval is enabled, the Time Approval tab allows managers or authorized users to review and approve timesheets.  Key features include:

searchDocs.title: IMAGE‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Members List: Displays all members who have logged time in the selected week.Calendar Widget: Enables week selection for reviewing submissions.Showing For: View all members or filter by a single member.Filter: Filter by Billable or Non-Billable entries.Search: Quickly locate entries or members for review by searching using Task ID, Task Name, or People.Approve / Reject: Approve valid entries or reject those needing corrections.  This ensures time data is validated before being finalized in reports.
